setting.name: Channel Mask
setting.description: This mask limits the channels that the radio will transmit on. See the manual for the list of frequencies. Channel 0 is bit 0. You must enable at least two channels, except when using only a single frequency of 869.85 MHz. When you use this mode (use 0x200000000) LBT+AFA will be disabled and the power level will be automactically will be limited to 5dBm. Examples: 863-865 use 0x1FF, 864-865 use 0x1E0, 863-868 use 0xFFFDFF, 863-865/868-868.6 use 0x60001FF. Channel/Bit Assignments: 0=863.15, 1=863.35, 2=863.55, 3=863.75, 4=863.95, 5=864.15, 6=864.35, 7=864.55, 8=864.75, 9=N/A, 10=865.15, 11=865.35, 12=865.55, 13=865.75, 14=865.95, 15=866.15, 16=866.35, 17=866.55, 18=866.75, 19=866.95, 20=867.15, 21=867.35, 22=867.55, 23=867.75, 24=N/A, 25=868.15, 26=868.35, 27=868.85, 28=869.05, 29=869.85

setting.name: Preamble ID
setting.description: The preamble ID for which the module communicates. Only modules with matching preamble IDs can communicate with each other. Different preamble ID's minimize interference between multiple sets of networks operating in the same vicinity. When receiving a packet this is checked before the network ID, as it is encoded in the preamble, and the network ID is encoded in the MAC header.

setting.name: Network ID
setting.description: The network ID. Only modules with matching IDs can communicate with each other. When receiving a packet this is checked after the preamble ID. If using OEM network IDs, 0xFFFF will use the factory value.

setting.name: Broadcast Multi-Transmits
setting.description: The number of additional broadcast retransmissions. All broadcast packets are transmitted MT+1 times to ensure it is received.

setting.name: RF Data Rate
setting.description: Select RF data rate (over-the-air transmission rate). DigiMesh and synchronized sleep are not supported when BR = 0.

setting.name: TX Power Level
setting.description: The transmitter output power level. These values include the gain of a 2 dBi antenna.

setting.name: Unicast Retries
setting.description: The maximum number of MAC RF packet delivery attempts of unicasts. If RR is non-zero then packets sent from the radio will request an acknowledgement and can be resent up to RR times if no acknowledgements are received.

setting.name: Bytes Transmitted
setting.description: The number of RF bytes transmitted. Every byte of every packet is counted, including MAC/PHY headers and trailers.

setting.name: Last Packet RSSI
setting.description: The RSSI of the last received packet in -dB. The received signal strength indication (RSSI) is acquired when a packet is being received by this module. In a mesh network the RSSI of the last hop is reported.

setting.name: Receive Error Count
setting.description: The number of RF Packets rejected because of bit errors in packet. Note that occasionally random noise can cause this value to increment.

setting.name: Good Packets Received
setting.description: The number of RF Packets successfully received.

setting.name: MAC ACK Failure Count
setting.description: The number of unicast transmissions that timed out awaiting a MAC ACK (Can be up to RR+1 timeouts per unicast when RR>0).

setting.name: Transmission Failure Count
setting.description: The number of unicast transmissions where retries expired with no ACK received (when RR>0).

setting.name: Unicasts Attempted Count
setting.description: The number of unicast transmissions expecting an acknowledgement (when RR>0).

setting.name: MAC Unicast One Hop Time
setting.description: The MAC unicast one hop time timeout in milliseconds.

setting.name: MAC Broadcast One Hop Time
setting.description: The MAC broadcast one hop time timeout in milliseconds.

setting.name: Routing/Messaging Mode
setting.description: The routing and messaging mode of the module. A routing module will repeat broadcasts. Indirect Messaging Coordinators will not transmit point-to-multipoint unicasts until they are requested by an end device. Setting a radio as a poller will cause it to regularly send polls to its Indirect Messaging Coordinator. Nodes can also be configured to route, or not route, multi-hop packets.

setting.name: Broadcast Hops
setting.description: The maximum transmission hops for broadcast data transmissions. Set the value to 0 for maximum hops. If BH is set greater than NH then the value of NH is used.

setting.name: Network Hops
setting.description: The maximum number of hops across the network. This number limits the number of hops and it is used to calculate maximum network traversal time. This value must be set to the same value on all nodes in the network.

setting.name: Mesh Unicast Retries
setting.description: The maximum number of network packet delivery attempts. If MR is non-zero, packets sent will request a network acknowledgement, and can be resent up to MR times if no acknowledgements are received. Changing this value will dramatically change how long a route request takes.

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: The upper 32 bits of the unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address assigned to this module.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: The lower 32 bits of the unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address assigned to this module.

setting.name: Destination Address High
setting.description: The upper 32 bits of the 64 bit destination address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Destination Address Low
setting.description: The lower 32 bits of the 64 bit destination address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Transmit Options
setting.description: The module's transmit options. These options are used for all transmissions (API transmissions can override this using the TxOptions field of the API frame). 0x40 = Point to Point/Multipoint, 0x80 = Repeater/Directed-Broadcast, 0xC0 = DigiMesh. See the product manual for further details on this command.

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: The node identifier string for this module. This can be up to 20 ASCII characters. This value is returned in a ND query and can be used to easily identify modules.

setting.name: Network Discovery Back-off
setting.description: The network discovery back-off parameter for this module. This sets the maximum value for the random delay used for network discovery responses to be sent.(Used for ND, DN, and FN commands.)

setting.name: Network Discovery Options
setting.description: Bit field of network discovery options for this module. Options include Bit 0 - Append DD value to end of network discovery, Bit 1 - Return devices own ND response first, Bit 2 - Include RSSI information in response.

setting.name: Cluster ID
setting.description: The default cluster identifier value used for serial data transmissions. If this value is set to 0x12 then the destination will echo any transmitted packet back to this module. The default value is 0x11.

setting.name: Network Discovery Timeout
setting.description: The maximum response time, in milliseconds, for network discovery (ATND) responses and discover node (ATDN) responses. The timeout is based on the network discovery back-off time (ATNT) and the network propagation time.

setting.name: Encryption Enable
setting.description: Enable or disable 128-bit AES encryption.

setting.name: Compatibility Options
setting.description: Set bit 2 to use ECB encryption. Clear bit 2 to use CTR encryption. All other bits should be 0.

setting.name: AES Encryption Key
setting.description: The 128-bit key used for encryption and decryption. This parameter cannot be read. (In compatibility mode, only LS 128 bits are used.)

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: The serial interface baud rate for communication between the serial port of the module and the host. Custom baud rates from 1200 (0x4B0) to 9600 (0x2580) and from 19200 (0x4b00) to 1873000 (0x1C9468) are supported.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: The parity for the UART.

setting.name: Stop Bits
setting.description: The number of stop bits for the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: The number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: The flow control threshold. De-assert CTS when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: The API mode setting. RF Packets received can be formatted into API frames to be sent out the UART. When API is enabled the UART data must be formatted as API frames as transparent mode is disabled.

setting.name: API Options
setting.description: The API data frame type output format for received frames.

setting.name: DIO0/AD0
setting.description: The DIO0/AD0 pin configuration. Options include: Commissioning button functionality, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO1/AD1
setting.description: The DIO1/AD1 pin configuration. Options include: Analog to Digital converter, and Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO2/AD2
setting.description: The DIO2/AD2 pin configuration. Options include: Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO3/AD3
setting.description: The DIO3/AD3 pin configuration. Options include: Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO4
setting.description: The DIO4 pin configuration. Options include: Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO5/ASSOCIATED_INDICATOR
setting.description: The DIO5/ASSOCIATED_INDICATOR pin configuration. Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated), Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO6/RTS
setting.description: The DIO6/RTS pin configuration. Options include: RTS flow control input, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO7/CTS
setting.description: The DIO7/CTS pin configuration. Options include: CTS flow control output, Digital Input and Output, or RS-485 enable control.

setting.name: DIO8/SLEEP_REQUEST
setting.description: The DIO8/SLEEP_REQUEST pin configuration. Options include: Sleep Request input, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO9/ON_SLEEP
setting.description: The DIO9/ON_SLEEP pin configuration. Options include: ON/SLEEP Output, Digital Input and Output, Sync Pulse output

setting.name: DIO10/RSSI/PWM0
setting.description: The DIO10/RSSI/PWM0 pin configuration. Options include: RSSI PWM Output, PWM0 Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO11/PWM1
setting.description: The DIO11/PWM1 pin configuration. Options include: 32.768KHz Clock Output, PWM1 Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO12
setting.description: The DIO12 pin configuration. Options include: Digital Input and Output

setting.name: DOUT
setting.description: The DOUT pin configuration. Options include: Disabled, UART DOUT enabled.

setting.name: DIN
setting.description: The DIN pin configuration. Options include: Disabled, UART DIN enabled.

setting.name: DIO15/SPI_MISO
setting.description: The DIO15/SPI_MISO pin configuration. Options include: SPI_MISO, and Digital Output.

setting.name: DIO16/SPI_MOSI
setting.description: The DIO16/SPI_MOSI pin configuration. Options include: SPI_MOSI, and Digital Output.

setting.name: DIO17/SPI_SSEL
setting.description: The DIO17/SPI_SSEL pin configuration. Options include: SPI_SSEL, and Digital Output.

setting.name: DIO18/SPI_SCLK
setting.description: The DIO18/SPI_SCLK pin configuration. Options include: SPI_SCLK, and Digital Output.

setting.name: DIO19/SPI_ATTN
setting.description: The DIO19/SPI_ATTN pin configuration. Options include: SPI_ATTN, UART Data Present Indicator, and Digital Output.

setting.name: Pull Direction
setting.description: The resistor pull direction bit field (1=pull-up, 0=pull-down) for corresponding I/O lines that are set in PR command.

setting.name: Pull-Up/Down Resistor Enable
setting.description: The bit field used to configure internal pull-up/down resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pull-up/down enabled, 0=no internal pull-up/down. Bit field map: (19)-DIO19/SPI_ATTN, (18)-DIO18/SPI_SCLK, (17)-DIO17/SPI_SSEL, (16)-DIO16/SPI_MOSI, (15)-DIO15/SPI_MISO, (14)DOUT, (13)-DIO7/CTS, (12)-DIO11/PWM1, (11)-DIO10/RSSI/PWM0, (10)-DIO12, (9)-DIO9/On/nSleep, (8)-DIO5/Assoc., (7)DIN/Config, (6)-DIO8/Sleep_Request, (5)-DIO6/RTS, (4)-DIO0/AD0, (3)-DIO1/AD1, (2)-DIO2/AD2, (1)-DIO3/AD3, (0)-DIO4/AD4

setting.name: PWM0 Duty Cycle
setting.description: The duty cycle of PWM0.

setting.name: PWM1 Duty Cycle
setting.description: The duty cycle of PWM1.

setting.name: Associate LED Blink Time
setting.description: The associate LED blink rate. This value determines the blink rate of the DIO5/Associate pin if D5=1. Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: The PWM timer expiration in 0.1 seconds. It sets the duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI pin. The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet and is shut off when the timer expires.

setting.name: Analog Voltage Reference
setting.description: The analog voltage reference that is used for A/D sampling.

setting.name: DIO Change Detect
setting.description: This is a bit field used for change detect monitoring. Each bit enables monitoring of DIO0-DIO12 for changes. If detected, data is transmitted with DIO data only.

setting.name: Sleep Sample Rate
setting.description: Set or read the number of sleep cycles that must elapse between periodic I/O samples. If set to zero then will start I/O sampling before the device sleeps and occurring thereafter every wake cycle specified by IR.

setting.name: Sample Rate
setting.description: The time between samples. When set this parameter causes the module to sample all enabled DIO and ADC at a specified interval.

setting.name: Temperature
setting.description: The current module temperature in degrees celsius in 8-bit two's-complement format. For example 0x1A = 26C, and 0xF6 = -10C

setting.name: Supply Voltage
setting.description: The supply voltage of the module in mV.

setting.name: I/O Output Enable
setting.description: Enable or Disable I/O data received to be sent out UART/SPI using an API frame when AP = 1 or 2 and when I/O line passing is enabled.

setting.name: I/O Input Address
setting.description: The source address of the module to which outputs are bound. Setting all bytes to 0xFF will disable I/O line passing. Setting IA to 0xFFFF will allow any I/O packet addressed to this module (including broadcasts) to change the outputs.

setting.name: D0 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D0 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D1 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D1 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D2 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D2 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D3 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D3 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D4 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D4 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D5 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D5 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D6 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D6 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D7 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D7 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D8 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D8 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: D9 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin D9 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P0 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P0 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P1 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P1 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P2 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P2 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P3 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P3 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: P4 Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long pin P4 will hold a given value before it reverts to configured value. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: PWM Output Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long both PWM outputs (P0, P1) will output a given signal before it reverts to zero. If 0, no timeout

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Normal mode is always awake. Pin sleep modes allow the module to be woken with the SLEEP_REQUEST line. Asynchronous cyclic mode sleeps for SP time and briefly wakes, checking for activity. Sleep Support mode is always awake but can effectively communicate with SM8 nodes. Synchronized Cyclic Sleep nodes sleep for SP and wake for ST time. Synchronous modes are not compatible with asynchronous modes.

setting.name: Sleep Options
setting.description: Sleep Options Bit field. Bit 0 - Preferred Sleep Coord. Setting this bit will cause a sleep compatible module to always act as sleep coordinator. Bit 1 - Non-Sleep Coord. will cause a module to never act as a sleep coordinator. Bit 2 - Enable API sleep status messages. Bit 3 - Disable automatic early wakeup for missed syncs. Bit 4 - Disable seniority based on module type. Bit 5 - Disable coordinator rapid sync deployment mode. Bit 8 - Always wake for ST time. Bit 10 - Enable randomized sync sleep I/O sampling.

setting.name: Number of Cycles Between On/Sleep
setting.description: The number of cyclic sleep cycles between assertions of the On/Sleep pin. This allows external circuitry to sleep longer than the SP time. Set to 1 to set On/Sleep high after each SP time (default). (Example: if SN=3, the On/Sleep line will assert only every third wakeup; SN=9, every 9th wakeup; etc.)

setting.name: Sleep Time
setting.description: The sleep time of the module. If 0, the module doesn't sleep

setting.name: Wake Time
setting.description: The wake time of the module. For synchronous sleep modules minimum wake time is a function of MT, SP, NH, and platform dependent values. Value will be raised automatically to a valid value when SP, NH, or MT are increased. Maximum value is an hour (or 0x36ee80 ms).

setting.name: Wake Host Delay
setting.description: The time the module will delay before sending serial data out the UART or taking IO samples after waking from sleep. This can be used to give a sleeping host processor sufficient time to power up after the module asserts the ON_SLEEP line.

category.name: Diagnostic - Sleep Status/Timing
category.description: Sleep Diagnostics and Timing. Click on + to expand the list of parameters.

setting.name: Sleep Status
setting.description: Bit field of sleep status bits. See product manual for full description. Bit 0 - Network awake, Bit 1 - Sleep coordinator, Bit 2 - Ever received sync, Bit 3 - Sync received this cycle, Bit 4 - Overriding sync pending, Bit 5 - Nomination requested, Bit 6 - Is in deployment mode. (All other bits are reserved and should be ignored).

setting.name: Operating Sleep Time
setting.description: The current network sleep time that this module is synchronized to, in units of 10 milliseconds. If this module has not been synchronized then OS will return the value of SP.

setting.name: Operating Wake Time
setting.description: The current network wake time that this module is synchronized to, in units of milliseconds. If this module has not been synchronized then OW will return the value of ST.

setting.name: Missed Sync Messages
setting.description: The number of sleep/wake cycles since the module received a sync message.

setting.name: Missed Sleep Sync Count
setting.description: The number of sleep cycles in which a sleep sync has not been received.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: The character value used to enter command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character. It must be entered three times within the guard time to enter command mode.

setting.name: Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: The command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, module returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: The required period of silence before, after, and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: The module firmware version number.

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: The module hardware version number.

setting.name: Hardware Series
setting.description: The module hardware series number. For example if the module is S8B this will return 0x801.

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: The Digi device type identifier value. This can be used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

setting.name: Maximum Packet Payload Bytes
setting.description: The maximum number of payload bytes that can be sent in a RF transmission.

setting.name: Configuration CRC
setting.description: The CRC of the current settings. The purpose of this command is to allow the detection of an unexpected configuration change on a device. After a firmware update this command may return a different value.
